result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

9:08 AM Defendant HEATH L FJORDEN in court, in custody.  Attorney Joshua M Andreasen in court for State of Wisconsin. JUDGE REVIEWS CHARGES/PENALTIES WITH DEFENDANT.  PUBLIC DEFENDER NOTICE GIVEN TO DEFENDANT. W/Reading - Adjourn
Initial appearance scheduled for December 7, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Motion hearing on November 30, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

2:58 PM Defendant HEATH L FJORDEN in court, in custody.  Attorney Joshua M Andreasen in court for State of Wisconsin.   DEF:  Stmts.  STATE:  Stmts.  DEF:  Stmts. STATE:  Object to bond modification.   DEF:  Stmts.  COURT:  Deny motion to modify bond.  Def to file proper paperwork/motion for release of cash.
Motion hearing on October 20, 2022 at 02:45 pm.

records.addlTxt: $350,000.00 Cash bond - No contact with JWE or JMK or their residences. Surrender his passport upon release from Juneau County Jail.

2:41 PM Defendant HEATH L FJORDEN appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Joshua M Andreasen in court for State of Wisconsin. JUDGE REVIEWS CHARGES/PENALTIES WITH DEFENDANT.  PUBLIC DEFENDER NOTICE GIVEN TO DEFENDANT. State - $350,000 Cash bond - No contact with JWE or JMK. Forfeit his passport upon release from Juneau County Jail. - Defendant disagrees - Court - $350,000 Cash bond - No contact with JWE or JMK or residences. Surrender his passport upon release from Juneau County Jail.
Initial appearance scheduled for October 26, 2022 at 09:00 am.
